message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SD

This paper deals with the automatic categorization of accounts of sexism on the web, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves the use of neural networks and deep learning, which suggests the sub-categories cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves the development of a flexible, hierarchical architecture involving recurrent components and optional convolutional ones, which suggests the sub-category cs.CY (Computational Geometry). Finally, the paper involves the use of unlabeled accounts of sexism to infuse domain-specific elements into the framework, which suggests the sub-category cs.SD (Sound).
